Keep silence before me, O islands; and let the people renew <FI>their<Fi> strength: let them come near; then let them speak: let us come near together to judgment.

Who raised up the righteous <FI>man<Fi> from the east, called him to his foot, gave the nations before him, and made <FI>him<Fi> rule over kings? he gave <FI>them<Fi> as the dust to his sword, <FI>and<Fi> as driven stubble to his bow.<RF>the righteous…: Heb. righteousness<Rf>
He pursued them, <FI>and<Fi> passed safely; <FI>even<Fi> by the way <FI>that<Fi> he had not gone with his feet.<RF>safely: Heb. in peace<Rf>
Who hath wrought and done <FI>it<Fi>, calling the generations from the beginning? I the LORD, the first, and with the last; I <FI>am<Fi> he.
The isles saw <FI>it<Fi>, and feared; the ends of the earth were afraid, drew near, and came.
They helped every one his neighbour; and <FI>every one<Fi> said to his brother, Be of good courage.<RF>Be…: Heb. Be strong<Rf>

So the carpenter encouraged the goldsmith, <FI>and<Fi> he that smootheth <FI>with<Fi> the hammer him that smote the anvil, saying, It <FI>is<Fi> ready for the sodering: and he fastened it with nails, <FI>that<Fi> it should not be moved.<RF>goldsmith: or, founder<Rf><RF>him…: or, the smiting<Rf><RF>saying…: or, saying of the soder, It is good<Rf>
But thou, Israel, <FI>art<Fi> my servant, Jacob whom I have chosen, the seed of Abraham my friend.
<FI>Thou<Fi> whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, and called thee from the chief men thereof, and said unto thee, Thou <FI>art<Fi> my servant; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.<CM>
Fear thou not; for I <FI>am<Fi> with thee: be not dismayed; for I <FI>am<Fi> thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.

Behold, all they that were incensed against thee shall be ashamed and confounded: they shall be as nothing; and they that strive with thee shall perish.<RF>they that strive…: Heb. the men of thy strife<Rf>

Thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, <FI>even<Fi> them that contended with thee: they that war against thee shall be as nothing, and as a thing of nought.<RF>them that…: Heb. the men of thy contention<Rf><RF>they…: Heb. the men of thy war<Rf>
For I the LORD thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
Fear not, thou worm Jacob, <FI>and<Fi> ye men of Israel; I will help thee, saith the LORD, and thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.<RF>men: or, few men<Rf>
Behold, I will make thee a new sharp threshing instrument having teeth: thou shalt thresh the mountains, and beat <FI>them<Fi> small, and shalt make the hills as chaff.<RF>teeth: Heb. mouths<Rf>
Thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carry them away, and the whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoice in the LORD, <FI>and<Fi> shalt glory in the Holy One of Israel.
<FI>When<Fi> the poor and needy seek water, and <FI>there is<Fi> none, <FI>and<Fi> their tongue faileth for thirst, I the LORD will hear them, I the God of Israel will not forsake them.
I will open rivers in high places, and fountains in the midst of the valleys: I will make the wilderness a pool of water, and the dry land springs of water.
I will plant in the wilderness the cedar, the shittah tree, and the myrtle, and the oil tree; I will set in the desert the fir tree, <FI>and<Fi> the pine, and the box tree together:
That they may see, and know, and consider, and understand together, that the hand of the LORD hath done this, and the Holy One of Israel hath created it.<CM>
Produce your cause, saith the LORD; bring forth your strong <FI>reasons<Fi>, saith the King of Jacob.<RF>Produce: Heb. Cause to come near<Rf>

Let them bring <FI>them<Fi> forth, and shew us what shall happen: let them shew the former things, what they <FI>be<Fi>, that we may consider them, and know the latter end of them; or declare us things for to come.<RF>consider…: Heb. set our heart upon them<Rf>
Shew the things that are to come hereafter, that we may know that ye <FI>are<Fi> gods: yea, do good, or do evil, that we may be dismayed, and behold <FI>it<Fi> together.
Behold, ye <FI>are<Fi> of nothing, and your work of nought: an abomination <FI>is he that<Fi> chooseth you.<RF>of nothing: or, worse than nothing<Rf><RF>of nought: or, worse than of a viper<Rf>

I have raised up <FI>one<Fi> from the north, and he shall come: from the rising of the sun shall he call upon my name: and he shall come upon princes as <FI>upon<Fi> morter, and as the potter treadeth clay.

Who hath declared from the beginning, that we may know? and beforetime, that we may say, <FI>He is<Fi> righteous? yea, <FI>there is<Fi> none that sheweth, yea, <FI>there is<Fi> none that declareth, yea, <FI>there is<Fi> none that heareth your words.
The first <FI>shall say<Fi> to Zion, Behold, behold them: and I will give to Jerusalem one that bringeth good tidings.
For I beheld, and <FI>there was<Fi> no man; even among them, and <FI>there was<Fi> no counsellor, that, when I asked of them, could answer a word.<RF>answer: Heb. return<Rf>
Behold, they <FI>are<Fi> all vanity; their works <FI>are<Fi> nothing: their molten images <FI>are<Fi> wind and confusion.<CM>
